title.narrative: Sida-NEFCO Consultant Cooperation Fund for Eastern Partnership: EaP

description.narrative:
Insatsen rör upprättande och finansiering av en fond för konsultstöd med syfte att identifiera, förbereda, genomföra och/eller utöva tillsyn på projekt inom området miljö och energieffektiviseringar i länderna i det Östliga Partnerskapet, dvs. Vitryssland, Georgien, Moldavien, Armenien, Ukraina och Azerbajdzjan, med fokus på Vitryssland, Georgien, Moldavien och Armenien.
Sida-NEFCO Östliga Partnerskapet Konsultfond stöder projekt inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Inom den offentliga sektorn, som dominerar, gäller stödet t.ex. kommunal infrastruktur med en tydlig reformagenda och med minskade föroreningar eller andra miljövinster som resultat. Inom det privata gäller stödet insatser inom i första hand jordbruks- och banksektorn. Investeringarna ska i båda fallen vara inte bara miljömässigt utan också tekniskt och finansiellt sunda.
Georgien och Moldavien har associeringsavtal med EU med omfattande miljöåtaganden. Detsamma gäller Ukraina vars stora behov sedan 2008 täcks av en konsultfond med ett syfte och arbetssätt som i princip är identiska med den föreslagna fondens. De övriga partnerskapsländerna tillämpar approximering till EU:s regelverk. Bland dessa har Vitrysslands behov hittills täckts genom en separat konsultfond. För att uppfylla högt ställda miljökrav på minskade utsläpp behövs i alla sex länder stora investeringar i t.ex. rening av avloppsvatten, avfallshantering, energieffektivisering i bostäder och offentliga byggnader.
NEFCO har ramavtal med länderna inom Östliga partnerskapet, med undantag för Moldavien och Azerbajdzjan. Ramavtalet med Moldavien förväntas bli klart i början av 2017. Därmed fungerar NEFCO som en internationell finansiell institution i länderna och tillämpar t.ex. för upphandling ett regelverk som är internationellt godkänt.
Insatsen genomförs under perioden 2016 - 2020 och beräknas till totalt 30 000 000 SEK, med en första utbetalning på 10 000 000 SEK år 2016.

preparatory and implementation support (consultancy assignments) for environment and enery projects
Distribution: No country allocations in advance.

The intervention's intended outcome is to by 2020 have agreed on financing for 8 projects with investments worth 40 million EUR. By 2020, 8 projects should also be implemented. The expected environmental benefits in terms of reduction phosphorous discharge to recipients (ton/yr) and reduction of CO2 and other climates gases (ton/yr) will be determined and reported on a project by project.

title.narrative: Agreement between Sida and NEFCO on the EaP Consultancy Trust Fund
Beslut om insats - NEFCO konsultfond för Östra Partnerskapsländerna

description.narrative:
The implementations of projects that were expected to materialize thanks to the provision of Sida financing to this trust fund has been much slower than originally expected. One of the main reasons for this is that progress on the development of projects in Belarus have been halted. NEFCO investment projects in the water and waste water sector in Belarus were the most advanced projects when this trust fund was established in 2016. Since then feasibility studies have been finalised, NDEP capex grants has been approved, and NEFCO has negotiated with the Belarusian authorities on how to structure the NEFCO loan for investments in upgraded waste water infrastructure in 2 Belarusian cities. Following the political developments in Belarus after the presidential elections in August 2020, these projects have been put on hold.
In Moldova the trust fund has financed consultancy support for the introduction of the NEFCO Energy Savings Credits Programme to Moldova. So far this has resulted in the approval of 4 NEFCO ESC loans to Moldovan municipalities, where 2 projects are currently under implementation. The preparatory work for potential NEFCO ESC has also resulted in a project proposal to E5P where NEFCO applied for E5P capex grants to a wider programme aimed at improving energy efficiency in smaller regional hospitals. This programme obtained an approval for E5P grants in November 2021 and NEFCO is aiming to sign a loan agreement with relevant municipalities in Q1 2022.
In Moldova NEFCO has also made use of the trust fund to prepare for an investment programme to increase the use of grid-connected photovoltaic (PV) systems in Moldova by 50 MW in the next five years, as a sustainable mean of generating electricity by establishing a credit facility for SMEs a and the residential sector together with local financial institutions. The project financing is expected as a combination of GCF (Green Climate Fund) loan and grant, NEFCO loan, and possibly also grant contributions from E5P. An application for this programme will be presented to GCF by NEFCO in 1H 2022.
In Armenia a similar consultancy for the introduction ESC to Armenian municipalities have been financed from the trust fund. Progress on this consultancy has been hampered by the Covid pandemic as well as the the armed conflict in Nagorno-Karabakh. Nevertheless it is still expected that this consultancy will result in 2-3 ESC being agreed with Armenian municipalities during 1H 2021.
In Georgia NEFCO has also reviewed the possibilities to introduce the ESC facility, but it appears that the interest for this facility is lower in Georgia. A feasibility study for energy efficiency investments in public buildings in montaineous regions in Georgia was finalised during 2021, which resulted in a project being presented to E5P for capex grant financing in October 2021. NEFCO loan signing and start of the implementation is expected during 1H 2022.
